title: Not displaying all local folders because windows path length too long SOLVED
creator: MisterKarlPrivate
content:
I am using Thunderbird V144.0.1 on a computer running Windows 11 Home build 26100. Suddenly, Thunderbird stopped displaying some of my Local Folders. I don't know what I did to cause it; I don't recall making any changes. On investigating the issue, none of the other help I found in the forums or elsewhere on-line worked for me.

While performing one of the instructions, I was trying to copy my Thunderbird profile mail folder to a different location before creating a new profile. Copying the folder gave me an error of a file name being too long. I moved the folder with the too-long file into a different subfolder with a shorter directory name. Lo and behold, all of my folders, including the ones I moved, are now appearing in my Thunderbird Local Folders.

I don't really need any help, but I wanted to post this solution since I didn't encounter it anywhere else.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/140.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Zámraz při přijetí nové zprávy
creator: Radas
content: Dobrý den, poslední dobou se začalo stávat, že pokud přijde nová zpráva, tak mi Tundrebird zamrzne. Musím ukončit přes správce úloh, znovu spustit a následně je Thnuderbird funkční i s nově přijatou zprávou. Paradoxně se toto chování Thunderbirdu děje náhodně. Například v pátek to bylo celý den bez problémů. Dnes do cca 8:00 také v pohodě a po osmé to začalo opět zamrzat. Zkoušel jsem ukončovat jednotlivé běžící programy, jestli náhodou nejsou v konfliktu, ale na nic jsem nepřišel. Nevíte náhodou někdo co s tím?

title: Moving an email from T'bird inbox to a subfolder
creator: a.m.packer
content:
Hi Mozilla People,

This concerns a minor but irritating problem in all the most recent versions of Thunderbird I've run.

When sorting through my Inbox, in the past, I would drag each message into the desired subfolder in the left hand column, and if that subfolder was above or below what was visible in the window, by dragging the message to the top or bottom of the window, the left hand column would scroll smoothly.

In the last several T'bird versions, this does not work very well. I drag the message to the top or bottom, but the column hardly scrolls at all. When the column is showing my folders that start with A through G, for example, and I want to put a message into the Weather folder, I have to drag the message to the bottom of the column and then keep moving it a little bit up and down until I finally get to Weather. It's hard on the thumb.

I assume that some setting got changed during one of the upgrades of the application, but I haven't been able to determine what setting, or what to do about it. Can you help?

Thunderbird is running in Linux Mint 22.1 "Xia" with kernel 6.8.0-86-generic, Mate desktop, on a Dell XPS-13 model 9300.

title: Persistent Google login popup even after Gmail account removal
creator: boukhlid1809
content:
Hello Thunderbird Support,

I’m having a recurring issue with Thunderbird continuously showing a Google login popup, even though I’ve already removed the Gmail account from Thunderbird.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

Deleted all Gmail accounts from Account Settings.

Removed all saved passwords (including OAuth tokens) from the Password Manager.

Deleted these files in the Thunderbird profile folder: logins.json, logins-backup.json, key4.db, cert9.db, pkcs11.txt

Deleted Gmail folders from ImapMail and Mail.

Checked “Manage Identities” and “Outgoing Server (SMTP)” — no Gmail entries remain.

Restarted Thunderbird multiple times.

Despite all this, the Google verification window (accounts.google.com) still appears when Thunderbird starts.

It looks like Thunderbird is keeping a hidden OAuth reference to the old Gmail account somewhere in the configuration files. Could you please help me identify how to fully remove this cached Gmail authentication so the popup no longer appears?

Thank you for your time and assistance.

Best regards, Khaled Ben Ali info@baktradingtn.com
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/141.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Auto labeling
creator: bostulpje
content:
I have two accounts AA and BB (as an example). One of them is my main account (AA) and the other account (BB) is set in such a way that from that account incoming messages automatically are forwarded to my main account (AA) inbox. The only distinction is the column "Receiver". In that column when Receiver is "BB" then it is coming from that account. Now I like to see that message line automatically also in another color to better distinguish the messages. It happens quite often that I reply to the open message from account BB, using account AA. And I didn't want that. Moreover, the recipient sees a different email address in his/her mailbox. That causes confusion.

Is it possible that the message that is automatically forwarded (or sent) from another account, causing the message to appear in my inbox (AA) automatically (now only manually?) in the color that is for example set in the 'Label' menu? So in my In-box I see the messages of two accounts. And to distinguish it easier for me I like to give the message of the other account another color. Is it possible (to make that)?
